title: Open Teamspeak for all!
body:
Hey guys, I'm the host of a decently sized team speak server. I'm posting here (again) to let anyone know that wants a consistent server to use that this is the one for you! I do my best to keep it up 24/7 with the occasional problem that's unavoidable like power going out. 
Ive had the server going for over a year and a half now so it wont be going anywhere anytime soon! 
You can either use the open rooms to mingle with randoms and play your games or if your part of a regular group that will use it feel free to ask me for a room and I will make one and give whoever you want channel admin of it.
We have plenty of room to expand so come join us!

The IP Address is 58.178.88.47 just message me, R3cip3 for anything you need.

replies.body:
Cheers mate, I have 1 also and was offering players the same deal lol.  ( I'll just leave mine to my Tanking buddies and hang with you guys instead lols) 
Cheers mate.
Just came here to say that you are SUCH a good dude man! Keep it up :) Hope someone rewards for this one day :D ahah

Teamspeak is the same as programs like vent and mumble, or skype in a way. Its purely there for voice chat and is less bandwidth intensive (unless theres a LOT of people on and talkign in one room) so yeah theres rooms on it which you join and talk in to people (youd have to look at it to know what i mean its simple though)
so basically its good for communities/groups of friends/teams you can just log on see whos on and yeah. 
I run a PC 24/7 for it and use my bandwith/data for it so in power terms yes it costs me but the server itself didnt as its running on an non profit licence.
OK so I'm new to teamspeak. What is the point of the server? Does it cost you money to keep the server? Please explain to me?:)
Thanks for the supportive messages guys :) Hope to see some of you on there!
